Description: Round bottomed bowl, sheet brass engraved and inlaid with silver, gold and black organic inlay. Around the outside of the bowl is an inscrption frieze interrupted by six roundels containing flying birds arranged symmetrically around an 8-petalled whirling rosette. Below this frieze is a narrow arabesque scroll border interrupted by six 6 petalled whirling rosettes. The base is decorated with a large roundel containing a design based on six intersecting circles. The interstices contain either four flying birds on interlace or plain interlace with a central multi-petalled whirling rosette. Around this is a wide band divided by slightly wavy interlace, plain interlace, groups of three vines or lotus. The interior base of the bowl is covered with a design of swimming fish and balls around a central multi-petalled whirling rosette. Despite the use of a compass, it is iregularly laid out.
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1977 London, BM, Animals in Art
